name: docker-credential-helper
description: Platform keystore credential helper for Docker

repo.name: docker-credential-helpers
repo.description: Programs to keep Docker login credentials safe by storing in platform keystores

readme.summary: Clear purpose and structure but lacks concrete examples, troubleshooting guidance, and a complete quick-start walkthrough.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section and minimal end-to-end examples showing actual credential storage/retrieval in action

injection_risks.description: The NewShellProgramFunc function uses exec.Command to execute a command with user-provided arguments, which can lead to shell injection attacks if not properly sanitized.
The Add function uses C.CString to convert Go strings to C strings, but it does not check for null bytes in the input strings, which can lead to buffer overflows.

critical_findings: Potential shell injection attacks due to unsanitized user input in the NewShellProgramFunc function.
Lack of input validation and sanitization in the client/client.go file.
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential shell injection attacks and lack of input validation, but it does not appear to expose sensitive information or use insecure defaults.

sentiment.summary: Community is engaged with security concerns and has prepared fixes, but release velocity for critical CVE patches appears slow.

communication.summary: The maintainer provides generally helpful and clear responses, demonstrating patience and technical depth, but could improve in welcoming new contributors and using more accessible language.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-09)
81 open issues with no closed issues in past 6 months indicates ignored bug reports
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months suggests pull requests are not being reviewed
Unknown last release date indicates release process has stalled
maintenance.summary: Project is effectively abandoned with stalled development despite recent commit activity, indicated by zero maintenance activity (no issue resolution, PR merging, or active contributors) over the past 6 months.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally clear and provides good installation instructions, but lacks a concise quick start guide and troubleshooting information.
concerns: Security: Potential shell injection attacks due to unsanitized user input in the NewShellProgramFunc function.
Security: Lack of input validation and sanitization in the client/client.go file.
Security: The NewShellProgramFunc function uses exec.Command to execute a command with user-provided arguments, which can lead to shell injection attacks if not properly sanitized.
